venue.title: Le Querce di Mamre
venue.blurb: Nestled in the heart of Apulia, Le Querce di Mamre is a timeless sanctuary of Mediterranean beauty. Surrounded by ancient oak trees and olive groves, this venue combines rustic charm with refined elegance, providing the perfect backdrop for our celebration.

ceremony.title: The Ceremony
ceremony.desc: Join us as we exchange our vows under the shade of ancient oaks in a heartfelt outdoor ceremony.

entrees.title: Entrées & Apertifs
entrees.desc: Enjoy a selection of traditional Apulian starters and refreshments in the garden, accompanied by gentle music.

lunch.title: Lunch & Party
lunch.desc: We move inside for an authentic Italian wedding feast, followed by dancing and celebration with our loved ones.

cake.title: Cake Cutting
cake.desc: A sweet moment as we cut our wedding cake together, marking the start of a magical evening under the stars.

afterparty.title: After Party & Open Bar
afterparty.desc: The celebration continues with an open bar and high-energy music to dance the night away until late.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.oneliner: Most answers can be found on the rest of the website, but this page is as comprehensive as possible to allow for easy searching.

questions.when_wedding_a: The wedding will take place on June 13, 2026.
questions.where_ceremony_a: The ceremony will be held outdoors at Le Querce di Mamre, Apulia.
questions.where_reception_a: The reception will also be at Le Querce di Mamre, transitioning from the outdoor garden to the indoor halls.
questions.arrival_time_a: We recommend arriving by 12:00 PM to find your seat comfortably before the 12:30 PM ceremony.
questions.dress_code_a: The dress code is Formal / Black Tie Optional. Gentlemen: Suits or Tuxedos. Ladies: Evening gowns or elegant cocktail dresses.
questions.outdoor_elements_a: The ceremony and initial drinks are outdoors (on grass), while lunch and the party are indoors.
questions.how_rsvp_a: You can RSVP directly on this website through the RSVP page.
questions.rsvp_deadline_a: Please let us know if you can make it by March 31st, 2026.
questions.plus_one: Can I bring a plus one?
questions.plus_one_a: Due to venue capacity, we can only accommodate those named on the invitation.
questions.children_a: We love your little ones, but our wedding will be an adults-only celebration.
questions.how_get_there_a: The nearest airports are Bari (BRI) and Brindisi (BDS). Detailed directions are on the Travel page.
questions.parking_a: Yes, there is ample complimentary parking available at the venue.
questions.hotels_a: Yes, we have listed several recommended hotels in various price ranges on the Travel page.
questions.transportation_a: Shuttle services will be arranged from the main town center to the venue. More details to follow.
questions.food_provided_a: Yes, we will serve a full multi-course Italian wedding lunch and evening refreshments.
questions.dietary_a: Absolutely! Please specify any allergies or requirements in your RSVP form.
questions.bar: Is the bar open or cash?
questions.bar_a: We will have an open bar throughout the celebration.
questions.gifts_expected_a: Your presence is the greatest gift, but if you wish to give, we appreciate your generosity.
questions.registry_a: Yes, you can find our gift registry link on the Registry page.
questions.gift_way: Is there a preferred way to give a gift?
questions.gift_way_a: Gifts can be sent via the registry or brought to the wedding.
questions.unplugged_a: Yes, we ask that you put away phones and cameras during the ceremony and be fully present with us.
questions.take_photos_a: You are welcome to take photos during the reception!
questions.hashtag: Will there be a wedding hashtag?
questions.hashtag_a: Yes! Please tag both the bride and groom when sharing your photos.
questions.schedule_a: The full schedule can be found on the Run of Show page.
questions.reception_end: What time will the reception end?
questions.reception_end_a: The celebration will conclude around 11:00 PM.
questions.rain_a: We have an indoor backup plan at the same venue, so the celebration will go on regardless of the weather!
questions.traditions: Will there be religious or cultural traditions guests should know about?
questions.traditions_a: The wedding will blend Italian and Czech traditions, celebrated with a heartfelt symbolic ceremony.

pescara.name: Pescara Airport (PSR)
pescara.desc: Approximately 1 hour 15 minutes from Apricena. A smaller airport with fewer connections but closer to our home base.

bari.name: Bari Airport (BRI)
bari.desc: The largest international airport in the region with the most flight options. About 1 hour 45 minutes from Apricena.

toCity.title: Getting to Apricena
toCity.desc: We'll be staying in Apricena, a charming town in the Gargano area. Here are your options to get there from the airports:
toCity.rentalDesc: Recommended for flexibility. Rent directly at the airport and drive via the A14 highway.
toCity.shuttleDesc: We can help arrange private transfers. Contact us if interested.
toCity.trainDesc: Take train to Pescara or Foggia, then taxi to Apricena.

toVenue.title: Getting to the Venue
toVenue.desc: The wedding venue is a short drive from Apricena:
toVenue.fromApricenaDesc: Approximately 15-20 minutes by car. We'll provide detailed directions closer to the wedding.
toVenue.parkingDesc: Free parking is available at the venue for all guests.

hotel.name: Hotel Options
hotel.desc: Several hotels available in and around Apricena. Recommended for those who prefer full amenities and daily housekeeping.
hotel.examples: Hotel Palazzo, Hotel Sant'Angelo, and others in the area

bnb.name: B&B / Agriturismo
bnb.desc: Experience authentic Apulian hospitality at local bed & breakfasts or farm stays. Often more charming and budget-friendly.
bnb.examples: Agriturismo options and local B&Bs in the countryside

beaches.title: Beaches & Coastline
beaches.desc: The Gargano coast offers some of Italy's most beautiful beaches and seaside towns.

polignano.title: Polignano a Mare
polignano.desc: Stunning cliffs and crystal-clear waters. Famous for its beach restaurant on a sea cave.

vieste.title: Vieste
vieste.desc: Charming coastal town with beautiful beaches and dramatic sea stacks.

peschici.title: Peschici
peschici.desc: Picturesque whitewashed village perched on cliffs with panoramic sea views.

towns.title: Hill Towns & Culture
towns.desc: Explore the charming historic towns of Apulia, each with unique character and history.

alberobello.title: Alberobello
alberobello.desc: Famous for its Trulli houses — unique cone-shaped dwellings and a UNESCO World Heritage site.
alberobello.tip: Tip: Visit early morning or late afternoon to avoid crowds.

ostuni.title: Ostuni
ostuni.desc: Known as the 'White City' for its whitewashed old town with winding medieval streets.
ostuni.tip: Tip: The sunset views from the cathedral are spectacular.

monte.title: Monte Sant'Angelo
monte.desc: Historic town home to the Sanctuary of Monte Sant'Angelo, a UNESCO site.

nature.title: Nature & Outdoors
nature.desc: The Gargano National Park offers incredible natural beauty and outdoor activities.

forest.title: Forest Umbra
forest.desc: Ancient beech and oak forest perfect for hiking and nature walks.

caves.title: Castellana Caves
caves.desc: Spectacular underground karst cave system with guided tours available.

tremiti.title: Tremiti Islands
tremiti.desc: Beautiful archipelago accessible by ferry. Perfect for day trips and snorkeling.

food.title: Food & Wine Experiences
food.desc: Apulia is a food lover's paradise. Don't miss these culinary delights!

wine.title: Wine Tasting
wine.desc: Visit local wineries to taste Primitivo, Negroamaro, and rosé wines.

oil.title: Olive Oil Tours
oil.desc: Learn about extra virgin olive oil production at historic masserie (farm estates).

cheese.title: Local Cheese
cheese.desc: Try burrata, mozzarella, and cacioricotta at local dairy farms.

money.title: Money Matters
money.desc: A few practical tips about payments and tipping in Italy.

currency.title: Currency
currency.desc: The currency is Euro (€). Credit cards are widely accepted in hotels, restaurants, and larger shops.
currency.tip: Tip: Carry some cash for small shops, markets, parking, and street vendors.

tipping.title: Tipping
tipping.desc: Tipping is appreciated but not mandatory. Service is usually included in the bill.
tipping.amount: Typical: Round up the bill or leave 5-10% for excellent service.

weather.title: Weather & What to Pack
weather.desc: June is beautiful in Apulia! Here's what to expect and pack.

june.title: June Weather
june.desc: Sunny and warm (25-30°C / 77-86°F). Perfect for outdoor celebrations!

attire.title: Dress Code Reminder
attire.desc: Formal / Black Tie Optional. See Dress Code page for details.

footwear.title: Footwear Note
footwear.desc: Ceremony is on grass — choose comfortable shoes for the outdoors!

customs.title: Italian Customs
customs.desc: Embrace the local rhythm and dining traditions.

riposo.title: The Riposo (Afternoon Break)
riposo.desc: Many shops and businesses close between 1pm-6pm. This is the traditional Italian afternoon break.
riposo.hours: Plan accordingly: Restaurants open for lunch 12-3pm, then dinner from 7:30pm onwards.

dining.title: Dining Etiquette
dining.desc: Italians take their meals seriously! Dinner is a leisurely affair, not rushed.
dining.reservations: Tip: Book restaurants in advance, especially Thu-Sun and in popular towns.

language.title: Language
language.desc: A few Italian phrases go a long way! 'Grazie' (thank you) and 'Per favore' (please) are appreciated.

water.title: Drinking Water
water.desc: Tap water is not served in restaurants. You'll purchase bottled water — it's the norm.

beaches.title: Beaches
beaches.desc: Most beaches are private lidos (paid). Look for 'spiaggia libera' signs for free beaches.

food.title: Food & Drink
food.desc: Apulian cuisine is incredible! Don't miss these local specialties.

specialties.title: Must-Try Dishes
specialties.desc: Orecchiette pasta, burrata cheese, fresh seafood, and focaccia are regional highlights.
specialties.examples: Look for: orecchiette con cime di rapa, polignano-style seafood, and pasticciotto for breakfast!

wine.title: Local Wines
wine.desc: Puglia is known for excellent wines, especially rosé and full-bodied reds like Primitivo.
wine.note: Ask for local recommendations — the wine here is fantastic and very affordable!

registry.title: Registry
registry.desc: Gifts are never expected, but always appreciated.
registry.presence_title: Your Presence is Our Greatest Gift
registry.presence_text: The most important thing for us is having you there to celebrate our special day. Your presence, laughter, and love are all we truly desire.
registry.honeymoon_text: If you wish to honor us with something more, a contribution towards our honeymoon adventures would mean the world. We're planning an unforgettable trip to create memories that will last a lifetime.
registry.thankyou: Thank you for your love and generosity.

dress_code.title: Dress Code
dress_code.desc: The dress code for our wedding is Formal / Black Tie Optional.
dress_code.gentlemen: Gentlemen are invited to wear a suit or tuxedo.
dress_code.ladies: Ladies are invited to wear a floor-length gown or a formal cocktail dress.
dress_code.note: The ceremony and drinks will be held on grass, so please choose your footwear accordingly.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.desc: If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to us directly.

map.desc: Explore locations across Apulia. Hover over markers to see details, and use the filters to show or hide different categories.
